intro: Loasa schlimiana, commonly known as the Schlim's loasa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, particularly in regions of Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow leaves, and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Loasa schlimiana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience in challenging climates.
